intro: Aeschynanthus tengchungensis, commonly known as the Tengchung bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves and has a compact, shrub-like appearance. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in greenhouses and botanical gardens.
